title: What is React?
answer: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

title: How do you create a component in React?
answer: You can create a component using a function or a class.

title: What is JSX?
answer: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that looks similar to XML or HTML.

title: What are props in React?
answer: Props are inputs to components. They are data passed down from a parent component to a child component.

title: What is state in React?
answer: State is a built-in object that stores property values that belong to a component.

title: How do you handle events in React?
answer: You handle events in React using camelCase syntax and passing a function as the event handler.

title: What is useState?
answer: useState is a React Hook that lets you add state to functional components.

title: What is useEffect?
answer: useEffect is a React Hook that lets you perform side effects in function components.

title: What is a key in React lists?
answer: A key is a special string attribute you need to include when creating lists of elements.

title: How do you pass data between components?
answer: You pass data from parent to child using props.

title: What is React Router?
answer: React Router is a library for routing in React applications.

title: What is context in React?
answer: Context provides a way to pass data through the component tree without having to pass props down manually at every level.

title: What is a controlled component?
answer: A controlled component is an input form element whose value is controlled by React state.

title: What is a pure component?
answer: A pure component is a component that does not re-render if its props and state have not changed.

title: What is Redux?
answer: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps.

title: What is a Higher-Order Component?
answer: A Higher-Order Component is a function that takes a component and returns a new component.

title: What is Prop Drilling?
answer: Prop Drilling is the process of passing data from parent to child to grandchild and so on.

title: What is memoization in React?
answer: Memoization is an optimization technique to speed up rendering by caching the result of expensive function calls.

title: What is lazy loading in React?
answer: Lazy loading is a technique to load components only when they are needed.

title: What is the virtual DOM?
answer: The virtual DOM is a programming concept where a virtual representation of the UI is kept in memory and synced with the real DOM.
